page.title: 03Turbine Generator Works.
page.content: The major source of employment in this area is the large G.E.C. plant which manfactures turbine generators.Built in 1956 it currently employs 770 workers.Raw materials are brought in by sea because Northern Ireland has no steel works. The company has supplied generators for power stations at Kilroot and Camlough in N.Ireland,and has cornered a large share of the world markets.Negotiations are currently in hand to develop sales potential in China. The company has an apprentice training scheme in association with the local College of further Education.
